title: name
comment: The title given to a person or object by one who is in a position of authority or ownership. Names often reflect the characteristics of a person or the aspirations or wishes for that person of the one bestowing the name.

children.title: name of God, significance of
children.comment: God's name is synonymous with his person, his presence and his power, and is therefore held in the highest honour.

children.title: God is referred to as the Name
God's person is revealed in his name
God's name is synonymous with his presence
The name of God identifies his people
Dishonouring God's name is a serious offence
The righteous honour God's name
The name of Jesus Christ
Supplication is to be made in the name of Jesus Christ
Healing and other miracles performed in the name of Jesus Christ
Baptism is in Jesus Christ's name
Salvation is in the name of Jesus Christ
names, significance of
children.comment: Labels that idenitfy individuals. They may also denote aspects of character or reputation.

children.title: A name may reflect an individual's nature
Additional names or nicknames

primaryrefs.comment: In NT times an additional name or surname reflecting someone's character was sometimes appended to the given name.

seealsos.comment: ``Cephas'' and ``Peter'' mean ``rock'' in Aramaic and Greek respectively

children.title: A name may indicate an individual's reputation and standing in the community
A good name indicates a good reputation
A bad name indicates a bad reputation
Survival of one's name is important
Preservation of a name indicates divine blessing
Obliteration of a name is associated with death
Obliteration of a name is often linked with divine judgment
Bearing someone's name indicates ownership or identification
God knows his people by name
names, giving of
children.comment: Scripture contains many examples of the naming of people and places. Personal names, usually given at birth by parents, were sometimes changed at a later date.

children.title: Names may reflect personal experiences
Names may reflect national experiences
Names may indicate future destiny
The giving of a name reflects the authority of the giver
The changing of names
On divine instruction
In relation to salvation
In the light of past experience
In the future
In a new culture
The instance of Paul

secondaryrefs.comment: The occasion of and reason for the change from ``Saul'' to ``Paul'' are not clear.

children.title: Place-names may reflect events or experiences
